msDesc.head: Augustine, Locutiones in Heptateuchum, Quaestiones in Heptateuchum, De baptismo contra Donatistas. 9th century, first half; part A Germany (Lorsch), part B Germany (Lorsch) or France (Arras)

supportDesc.foliation: i-ii, 1-300. Incomplete 17th(?)-century foliation in ink, completed in 19th-century pencil.

binding.p: Standard Laudian binding of calf over pasteboards, 1638 or 1639; sewn on 5 bands.

history.provenance: The two units of the volume perhaps first brought together at the Cisterican abbey of Eberbach: Liber sancti Marie virginis in Ebirbach, fol. 2r (late 14th or 15th century); probably identifiable as G9 in the 1502 catalogue, 'Liber locutorum augustini in geneseos Initium Locutiones scripturarum' (N. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher (1998), p. 238); both parts probably removed from Lorsch to Eberbach between 1233 and 1245 while Lorsch was administered by monks from Eberbach (Palmer, p. 18)
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639. Former shelfmark L. 32.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford, September 2021. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 131–2 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 67

bibl.note: (full facsimile with manuscript description by Michael Kautz)

listBibl.bibl: Bernhard Bischoff, Katalog der festländischen Handschriften des neunten Jahrhunderts (2004) II.3835-7 (fols. 3-298 as 9th century, second quarter)
Bernhard Bischoff, Die Abtei Lorsch im Spiegel ihrer Handschriften, 2nd ed. (1989), 41, 110 (9th century, first half)

msItem.note: Fol. 2r blank except for later ex libris

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Retractationes
msItem.rubric: Retractatio huius operis ita se habet lxxx locutionum libri septem

msItem.note:
Contents list for fols. 3-206, in uncial: In hoc corpore continentur
sancti Augustini locutionum libri num. VI
et questionum libri num. VII

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Locutiones in Heptateuchum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber locutionum sancti Augustini in Geneseos
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt locutiones Iudicum qui est sancti Augustini liber septimus
msItem.note: Bk. 2, Exodus, fol. 12r; bk. 3, Lev., fol. 20r (rubric, 19v); bk. 4, Num., fol. 22r; bk. 5, Deut., fol. 27r; bk. 6, Josh., fol. 30v; bk. 7, Judges, rubric fol. 32v (the folio half blank after the end of bk. 6), text fol. 33r.
msItem.bibl: ed. CSEL 28.1 (this ms. siglum L), CCSL 33 (this ms. siglum L)

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Retractationes
msItem.rubric: Commemoratio huius operis in libro retractationum ita se habet lxxxi questionum liber septem

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Quaestiones in Heptateuchum
msItem.rubric: (fol. 37r) Incipiunt capitula quaestionum de libri Geneseos
msItem.incipit: Cum scripturas sanctas quae appellantur canonicae
msItem.note: Exodus, fol. 70r; Lev., fol. 115r; Num., fol. 141v; Deut., fol. 161v; Ios., fol. 177v; Judges, fol. 187v. Fols. 115-160 and 161-206 are separate production units; fol. 160v half-blank, but text continuing without a break from 'fit non tantum' to fol. 161r 'in adpetendo' (4.59). Fol. 206v blank.
Fol. 68 is a 15th-century replacement leaf (containing 1.164 'genuisset Ioseph' - 1.169 'fecisset dominus cum discipulis suis').

supportDesc.collation: 1(8+1) (fol. 2 added at the beginning of the quire), 2(8)-3(8), 4(10) (fols. 2-36) | 5(8)-13(8), 14(8-2) (last two cancelled) (fols. 37-114), quires 11-13 numbered vii-viiii, final verso, bottom centre | 15(8)-19(8), 20(8-2) (last two cancelled) (fols. 115-160) | 21(8)-25(8), 26(6) (fols. 161-206), quires 21-25 numbered i-v, final verso, bottom centre.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in hard point for one column of 30 lines with double vertical bounding lines. Ruled space 185-90 170-5 (185 mm. to the outer bounding lines)

handDesc.handNote: Caroline minuscule by several hands in the 'jüngerer Lorscher Stil' (Bischoff).

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials in red or in the ink of the text.

physDesc.additions: Art. 2 with numerous later-medieval nota marks.

history.origin: 9th century, first half or second quarter Germany, Lorsch, Benedictine abbey (Bischoff); fol. 68, 15th century, presumably Eberbach, Cistercian abbey
history.provenance: Lorsch, Benedictine abbey: identifiable in the library catalogues (A. Häse, Mittelalterliche Bücherverzeichnisse aus Kloster Lorsch. Einleitung, Edition und Kommentar (2002), no. 146).

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De baptismo contra Donatistas
msItem.incipit: In eis libris quos aduersus epistolam Parmeniani
msItem.explicit: ut in eo quod aliter sapiebant donec Deus id quoque
msItem.note: Ending incomplete at VII.54.103 due to loss of a leaf.
msItem.bibl: Ed. CSEL 51, this ms. siglum J.

supportDesc.collation: 1(8)-11(8), 12(four); quires numbered i q, ii q etc. within decorative strokes, on the final verso, bottom inner corner.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with a hard point for two columns of 29 lines. Ruled space 185 160 with 25 mm. between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Caroline minuscule by one hand in the 'St Vaast' style (for which see Bischoff 1989, 41-4).
Rubrics and some incipits in uncial.

history.origin: 9th century, first half or second quarter France, north-east, Arras, St Vaast or Germany, Lorsch, Benedictine abbey
history.provenance: Script in the 'St Vaast' style; written perhaps at St Vaast for export to Lorsch (Bischoff 2004, no. 3837) or perhaps at Lorsch itself (Bischoff 1989, p. 110); Adalung, abbot of Lorsch 804-837 was also abbot of St Vaast from 808 (Bishoff 1989, pp. 41-4).
Lorsch, Benedictine abbey: probably identifiable in the library catalogues (A. Häse, Mittelalterliche Bücherverzeichnisse aus Kloster Lorsch. Einleitung, Edition und Kommentar (2002), no. 127).

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: Expositio in Ps. CXVIII
msItem.incipit: uestigiis et uiam ueram inuenire nequeamus
msItem.explicit: ut luceat omnibus qui in domo sunt, vt
msItem.bibl: CSEL 62, pp. 300-303. Another fragment of this manuscript is MS. Laud Misc. 417 fol. 1.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with a hard point for two columns of 29 lines with double vertical bounding lines. Ruled space 220 175 (c. 180 mm. to the outer bounding lines)

handDesc.handNote: Caroline minuscule, 'jüngerer Lorscher Stil' according to Bischoff.

history.origin: 9th century, first half or second quarter Germany, Lorsch, Benedictine abbey (Bischoff)
history.provenance: Lorsch, Benedictine abbey: probably identifiable in the library catalogues (A. Häse, Mittelalterliche Bücherverzeichnisse aus Kloster Lorsch. Einleitung, Edition und Kommentar (2002), no. 213).
